fields.description:
My request is to be able to mention without requiring to assign the "Browse Users" global permission. JRASERVER-7467 asks to restrict the browse users permission to project users, which would resolve our issue, because then we would be able to assign "Browse Users" global permission to all our customers with no information leakage.

However, JRASERVER-7467 has been parked because it is very difficult to solve. It is difficult to decide exactly which users to show and which users to hide. Therefore, I request to track the mention subproblem separately, because it is much easier to solve: show the users which can browse the issue you are mentioning on - just like JIRA already does.
fields.summary: Ability to @mention user without 'Browse Users' global permission

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The very helpful sprint estimate summary that is available for planned sprints on the backlog view as ilustrated below, isn't displayed in a few scenarios.
 !Selection_544.jpg|thumbnail! 
This summary is very useful as it allows you to have an overview of the sprint estimation without any additional clicks. The following are some scenarios where you don't have this summary displayed:
* When the sprint panel is collapsed, this estimate summary disappears.
 !Selection_545.jpg|thumbnail! 
* The estimate is also not displayed for active sprints, only planned sprints.
 !Selection_547.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
* Keep the estimate summary at the bottom of a collapsed panel, there's still plenty of empty space to display it for the collapsed panel as currently is. 
* Display the estimate summary for active sprints as well.

h3. Workaround
There is a button (with 3 dots or ellipsis) underneath the sprint name that can actually be used to preview a more detailed sprint estimate summary as illustrated below. Although it requires an additional click to display, it's a consistent way to always be able to see the sprint estimate summary from backlog view:
 !Selection_546.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Provide the sprint estimate summary more consistently in the backlog view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When admin attempts to delete a permission, a 500 SocketTimeoutException is thrown, a InvalidCharacter error is logged in browser's console and permission is not deleted.
h3. Environment

IE 11
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login to JIRA as administrator
 # Go to any project's settings
 # Click on Permissions (left menu)
 # Click on Actions button
 # Select Edit permissions
 # Try to delete any permission.

h3. Expected Results

Permission is successfully deleted, no errors are thrown.
h3. Actual Results

The below exceptions can be observed. Permission is not deleted.

!Screen Shot 2019-03-11 at 15.28.01.png|thumbnail!!Screenshot 2019-03-19 at 08.06.43.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

Does not always reproduce. Currently not all circumstances required for this to happen are known. Description will be added once they're discovered.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unable to delete a permission in IE 11

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Vendor has a JIRA Server plugin that has a web-panel configured at location "servicedesk.portal.subheader" as such:


_/src/main/resources/atlassian-plugin.xml_
{code:java}
<web-panel key="view26-sd-portal-reports-webpanel" location="servicedesk.portal.subheader">

    <condition class="com.view26.jira.common.OrganizationAvailableCondition"/>

    <context-provider class="com.view26.jira.webpanel.WebPanelContext" />

    <resource name="view" type="velocity" location="templates/portal.vm" />

</web-panel>
{code}

This velocity template uses $webResourceManager.requireResource to load "com.atlassian.auiplugin:dialog2"

_/src/main/resources/templates/portal.vm_
{code:java}
$webResourceManager.requireResource("com.atlassian.auiplugin:dialog2")
{code}


In *Jira 7.10.2* with *ServiceDesk 3.13.2*

Customer Portal loads properly when plugin key in pom.xml is 'com.view26.jira'

_/pom.xml_
{code:java}
    <groupId>com.view26</groupId>
    <artifactId>jira</artifactId>
{code}

But Customer portal does not load when plugin key is changed to 'com.view26.servicedesk-report.jira' with everything else remaining the same.

_/pom.xml_
{code:java}
    <groupId>com.view26</groupId>
    <artifactId>servicedesk-report.jira</artifactId>
{code}

The blank screen has a console error - "Uncaught Error: No aui/dialog2"

Sample App:  [^jira.zip]  

h3. Background and Notes
* I have replicated this issue for their app but with a fresh app with the same plugin keys, velocity template with webResourceManager.requireResource, and appropriate versions, I don't have the issue. Sample app: [^myplugin.zip] 
* Vendor needs help finding out the root cause as this is a blocker
fields.summary: $webResourceManager.requireResource does not work for some plugin keys and results in AUI error

fields.description:
h4. Issue

* Unable to search 'status' column in issue navigator when I have many custom fields include 'status' in the filed name.
 !status.png|thumbnail! 

h4. Suggestion

* Users should be able to search the 'status' column successfully even when there are many custom fields contain 'status' in their name. 

h4. Workaround

Option I

 # Perform an issue query or click "View all issues and filters" to cause a list of issues to be displayed.
 # Click on the "Columns" dropdown.
 # Scroll to the bottom of the list.
 # Right-click on the text "Continue typing to refine further". (You can actually right-click anywhere in the Columns chooser, but this puts you close to the tag you're going to be looking for in step 6.)
 # Select "Inspect" (on Chrome). This should open a browser development window to the right where you can inspect and modify the page's HTML.
 # In the "Elements" window at the top of the inspection area (on Chrome), scroll down until you see an element titled "<select id="user-column-sparkler"...>".
 # Expand "user-column-sparkler".
 # Expand "optgroup label" within it.
 # Scroll down until you find the node "<option title="Status" value="status">Status</option>" (It may be necessary to click "Show all nodes" to see it.)
 # Right-click on that node and select "Add attribute". Type: selected="selected". The node should now read:
"<option title="Status" value="status" selected="selected">Status</option>"
 # Click "Done" back in the column chooser widget.
 # The "Status" column should now appear in your issues list. It should not be necessary to repeat this.

Option II

# Rename the custom field to something else which does not cause this issue in the Column search.
# Add this renamed field as a column to the List View in the Issue Navigator
# Rename the custom field back to what it originally was
fields.summary: Unable to search 'status' column in issue navigator when I have many custom fields include name 'status'

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Code on visual mode isn't correctly rendered and indentation isn't rendered showing text incorrectly.

h3. Environment

(!) Jira 7.7.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Try copying three different code examples into code blocks. When you insert a Code block, if it's populated with // code placeholder, then there's no problem
But if it's not populated with that placeholder, then the problem happens.

Take note that this affects Preformatted as well - it's populated with *no* further _formatting_ is done here.
Text mode is a workaround for both Code and Preformatted.

h3. Expected Results

Code gets rendered correctly

h3. Actual Results

Text and code does not indent correctly (see the video for more details)

 [^codevisual_2.mp4] 

h3. Notes

(Optional - If Necessary)
h3. Workaround

Switch to Text mode and add text normally. It'll indent correctly.
fields.summary: Code on visual mode isn't correctly rendered and indentation isn't rendered showing text incorrectly.

fields.description:
h4. Issue

* Currently, if you forward a mail as an attachment using Microsoft Outlook (or if you directly attach an email as an attachment), it shows up in a JIRA issue as a file with no extension. Because there is no extension, clicking on the file does not open it in the appropriate way and file is not readable. 
* If the same mail attachment was sent to Jira via the mail web browser, the file extension exists in the original email and the .msg file can be viewed correctly. 

h4. Cause 

* It is because when the mail was sent from outlook, there is no file extension in the original email that was sent to Jira's incoming mail handler. 

h4. Suggestion

* Jira should be able to detect the file as mail attachment without file extension so that end user can view the .msg file properly after the new issue is created.
fields.summary: Add functionality to process outlook message attachments into .msg format in regular Jira incoming mail handler

fields.description:
Current situation:

You can turn batching email notifications on or off. This applies to all projects.

 

Requested situation:

Being able to turn batching email notifications on or off per project.

The reason is that for Jira Service Desk, it's not always convenient to have batching, since it causes delay in receiving notifications. And since Jira Service Desk is all about Incidents, it causes delay in solving Incidents, which customers don't like.
fields.summary: Option to configure batching email notifications per project

fields.description:
h3. Problem

While converting JQL query to Lucene query Jira tries to guess projects to which the results will belong. This enables Jira to perform some optimisations. For example:
 * Optimised security qeury
 * version functions are expanded to versions from only related projects.

Unfortunately, those guessed projects are not passed into subqueries.
The problem reveals itself on Kanban board with default Kanban sub-filter:
{noformat}
fixVersion in unreleasedVersions() OR fixVersion is EMPTY
{noformat}

h3. Test case
 * Create 2 Kanban projects
 * Create 33k unreleased versions for each project (66k in total)
 * Try opening Kanban board

h3. Expected result

Everything works. Lucene query contains 33k versions from current project. (optimization worked and sub-filter receives the project scope)
h3. Actual result

Jira tries to create Lucene query with 66k versions from the whole instance. (Optimization failed)
 It also fails due to BooleanQuery limit.
h3. Workaround

Removing '{{OR fixVersion is EMPTY}}' fixes the optimisation.
fields.summary: DeterminedProjectsInQueryVisitor doesn't work for default Kanban sub-query

fields.description:
There could be times where some sensitive data could be inadvertently added to an issue in a text format, on a comment, description, or other forms (Fields, etc). For security reasons and due to regulations (GDPR and others), this information needs to be removed from the instance. Although the user can remove the text, the information will still be present on the history and activity tab of the issue. 

Since the history tab can't be disabled (JRACLOUD-67300), Would be useful, and at some point necessary, that the administrators have the ability to remove data from the history or activity tab in case they need to hide sensitive information from the instance.  This would also remove the information on the activity stream where users can see all the changes.
fields.summary: Ability to remove specific information from history and activity Tab

fields.description:
h5. Problem Definition
At the moment, there is no default logging for com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.ConnectionPoolHealthSqlInterceptor. As a result, sometimes JIRA gets detailed in logging the stack trace on DB connection pool usage. See JRASERVER-44816.

h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have the the logging level set to ERROR by default for 
{code}
com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.ConnectionPoolHealthSqlInterceptor
{code}
This way, we can avoid JRASERVER-44816, and still get important stack trace when the real issue with DB connection pool usage happens
fields.summary: Have default log level for com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.ConnectionPoolHealthSqlInterceptor

fields.description:

* We may also want to make it clear in the documentation that Manage Sprints permission doesn't have any effect on the ability to add or remove issues to sprints

Found 1 unprocessed message in pop3 folder
Cannot add comment because user user '...' has no permission on issue '...'

{code}

Text in certain drop down fields, and on certain screens don't appear to be positioned correctly inside the field (e.g. Linked Issues or resolution fields on Issue screens). For instance the tails of small letter y or p etc are cropped at the bottom of the field as shown below

h3. Environment
Browsers from Windows Clients (Win 7, 10 tested) are affected based on our tests. Linux or Mac clients weren't affected regardless of browser.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up a fresh JIRA installation and create a sample project.
# Configure a issue edit or transition screen to include either the Linked issues or Resolution field on the screen respectively.
# Try to edit or transition an issue

h3. Expected Results
Text is positioned correctly in the middle of the field with some field padding around the edges of the field.

h3. Actual Results
Text appears over-sized in the fields and a small portion of the bottom of the text is cropped out.
 !replicate.jpg|thumbnail! 
 !replicate2.jpg|thumbnail! 
Above was reproduced with Chrome on Windows 10. Could reproduce with 

h3. Notes
* Couldn't reproduce the same issue on JIRA 7.4 using the same clients.
* Could reproduce this on JAC running JIRA 8.0. The following is the same issue shown replicating the issue on a windows client, being unable to reproduce with same issue on JAC when viewed from an Ubuntu client using Chrome as well:
 !Selection_535.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
No decided workaround at the moment

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, if a user uses a CSV file which contains locked field and also some values which could be new custom field option, the import process will be adding new custom filed options.

This could be problematic for the Jira Software custom fields like "Epic Status".


h3. Suggested Solution

Prevent CSV import from adding custom field option for locked fields.


h3. Workaround 

Unlock the locked custom field by following steps in [How to unlock a Locked Jira Software Field|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-unlock-a-locked-jira-software-field-779158866.html] and remove the additional custom field options if CSV import added new custom field options.
fields.summary: Prevent CSV import from adding custom field option

fields.description:
Requesting Jira Data Center support certificate based client authentication as described in [RFC 8705|https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc8705].

Within certain organizations, it would be very convenient to be able to authenticate users with x509 certificates.

Implementation would require custom OSUser providers to:
 * check client certificate for:
 ** revocation
 ** validity
 ** identity
 * map the certificate to a JIRA username (CN to username?) and proceed with normal authorization
fields.summary: x509 client certificate Authentication and Authorization support

fields.description:
"+1" comments are often annoying and generate extra email and comment "noise." To discourage users from posting +1 comments, I suggest the following:

If a user attempts to add a comment with the text "+1" display the following:
 # Their comment in editable form
 # A message that
 ## indicates that a "plus one" comment was detected
 ## describes why this is a bad idea
 ## describes how the user can vote for an issue instead
 # Buttons with the following actions:
 ## Vote for the issue without a comment
 ## Vote for the issue and submit the comment
 ## Submit comment without voting
 ## Cancel

 

The feature should check if the user has voting rights and adjust what it displays/offers accordingly.

The feature may also provide administrators the ability to customize the message.

The feature may restrict where is searches for the "+1" text and or search for additional text. For example, maybe only "+1" on the first or last line will be flagged. Or, maybe the text "plus 1" and "plus one" is also flagged. Atlassian might be able to grep their own Jira databases to see what the most common patterns are and only search for those to help avoid false positives.
fields.summary: Filter plus one comments

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
There are use-cases for aborting a healthy reindexing operation:
* Accidental click on the start reindexing button.
* Cluster is under heavy load; would like to have all nodes available for servicing requests (and no extra pressure on the db from reindexing).
* CF changes while reindexing

h3. Suggested Solution
Allowing Jira DC admins to abort a foreground reindex that's working correctly on an active node.
 
h3. Workaround 
* Remove the node from LB
* Shutdown the node
fields.summary: As an JIRA Datacenter Administrator I want to be able to cancel Full reindex

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating a linked issue and copying attachments leads to the following error to be thrown :
{code:java}
java.lang.ClassCastException: io.atlassian.fugue.Either$Right cannot be cast to com.atlassian.fugue.Either {code}
However, even when the error is thrown, the linked issue will be created in the background.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Head to an issue in a Business/Service Desk project.
 # Add an attachment to the issue.
 # Click on *More > Create Linked Issue*.
 # Add required fields. Click on *Copy Attachments*.

h3. Expected Results

Create Linked Issue page will refresh and the linked issue will be shown to be created successfully.
h3. Actual Results

Create Linked Issue page does not refresh and will throw this error :
{noformat}
java.lang.ClassCastException: io.atlassian.fugue.Either$Right cannot be cast to com.atlassian.fugue.Either 
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

As the issue is created in the background, user can refresh the browser or exit the page.
fields.summary: Creating a linked issue while copying attachments leads to the error 'java.lang.ClassCastException: io.atlassian.fugue.Either$Right cannot be cast to com.atlassian.fugue.Either' to be shown in the screen.

Estimate time can saved normally.

Field shows "The original estimate specified is not valid." error and can't save the value.

No workaround

fields.description:
If you have more than 1 dashboard, all dashboard names are listet ont he left - in addition to the already existing Dashboards menu. This{color:#de350b} takes up space{color} that is much more valuable in the dashboard itself.

If I remove all dashboards except 1 from my "favorite" dashboards, the panel on the left vanishes. But then, the Dashboards menu also does not show my other dashboards.

Suggestions:
 * make the dashboard selection panel {color:#00875a}hideable{color} (either by configuration or by little arrow to collapse the panel)
 * in the Dashboards menu, show all of "{color:#00875a}My{color}" dashboards - not only the "{color:#de350b}favorite{color}" dashboards.
fields.summary: Dashboards: make dashboard list hideable / show "My" dashboards in Dashboards menu

fields.description:
I have multiple dashboards and some widgets need to have more (horicontal) space than others.  The current layouts are too restricted as they only offer misc horizontal partitions. As I know the problems of layouting, the follwong layout should be easy to implement:

The upper boxes/widgets can occupy the full width - no matter how many. The lower boxes/widgets could use one of the already existing layouts (<n> columns).

This would allow to add widgets with wider horizontal space requirements to add as top widgets, while the widgets with narrow horizontal space can be added below in on of the columns:

############################################

############################################

############################################

#############  #############  ################

#############  #############  ################

#############  #############  ################

#############  #############  ################

#############  #############  ################

 

Yeah?
fields.summary: New dashboard layout: columns below lists

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

Unable to use the Manage Add-ons page if the user is using the Dutch language / Nederlands (Nederland) in JIRA user language setting. 
 !Screenshot 2019-03-07 at 1.52.19 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
# Simply change your user preferred language to Nederlands (Nederland). 
# Access the page at *Administration > Add-ons > Manage add-ons*. 

h3. *Expected Results*

Expect it to load normally and we can manage the add-ons. 

h3. *Actual Results*

 !Screenshot 2019-03-07 at 1.52.19 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. *Notes*

- This is also affecting the JIRA system language but the user language setting will override the system language. 
- The problem itself lies in the JIRA Core language pack located at {{[$JIRA_INSTALL|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+Installation+Directory]/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins/jira-core-language-pack-nl_NL-8.0.0.v20190201000500.jar}} where there is a file in the JAR: /com/atlassian/upm/i18n_nl_NL.properties is having a wrong close bracket type at line 541: 
{code:none} 
upm.plugin.action.license.role.dialog.upgrade=Mogelijk moet je je {0}-licentie upgraden voordat je je {1)-licentie kunt upgraden. Zorg ervoor dat je licentie voor {0} voldoende gebruikers ondersteunt om deze app te licenti\u00ebren.
{code} 
Wrong bracket, should be {{\{1\}-licentie kunt upgraden}}: 
{code:none} 
{1)-licentie kunt upgraden
{code} 
- The following stack trace is also observed in the logs: 
{code:none}

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
FieldConfigScheme#getAssociatedIssueTypes returns a collection of size 0 even if there are IssueTypes associated to it

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create project
# Create two IssueTypes
# Create IssueTypeScheme 
# Associate IssueTypeScheme with the two IssueType just created.
# In the project setting, associate a project with the Default Issue Type Scheme. Now the created IssueTypeScheme is not associated with any project.
# Call FieldConfigScheme#getAssociatedIssueTypes

h3. Expected Results
The two issue types should be returned i.e. a {{Collection}} containing 2 elements of class IssueType

h3. Actual Results
A {{Collection}} of size 1, containing null. System reports all elements are null when debugging, or the list is of size 0.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: FieldConfigScheme#getAssociatedIssueTypes returns a collection of size 0 even if there are IssueTypes associated to it

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
h3. Environment
Jira and MSSQL Server

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a webhook configuration setting at Jira
# Copy a few entries from a Microsoft Suite Tool such as Word and paste in a text field (e.g Comment) such as the example below:
#* Hey there – this is typing in MS Word 2013.  Let’s see if the ‘apostrophes’ and “quotes” make it to JIRA as weird characters!!!  Here is another “ quote “ just in case grammar is not someone’s forte!

h3. Expected Results
Jira sends the webhook with the same formatting than the source (i.e Microsoft Word)

h3. Actual Results
Jira sends the webhook, but the special characters are translated to hexadecimal or to question marks as the log below that's displayed when the class "com.atlassian.webhooks" is set to "debug": {noformat}"displayName":"admin","active":true,"timeZone":"America/Sao_Paulo"},"body":"\r\nHey there ? this is typing in MS Word 2013.  Let?s see if the ?apostrophes? and ?quotes? make it to JIRA as weird characters!!!  Here is another ? quote ? just in case grammar is not someone?s forte!"{noformat}

h3. Notes
* This problem does not occur when inputting special characters to Jira directly.
* This problem does not occur when Jira is associated with different DBMS such as PostgreSQL

h3. Workaround
Besides the notes above, there's no known workaround
fields.summary: Webhook does not send special characters when copying/pasting from Microsoft Tools (i.e Word) when Jira is configured with SQL Server

fields.description:
JIRA would be much more Agile if a sprint could become Not Active, after becoming Active.

Currently, it is impossible in JIRA for the user to change their mind, once a sprint becomes Active.  I have been unable to find a practical reason for this behavior.

JIRA should be consistent between different features in the product, such as Issues and Sprints.  Notice the design and support for moving individual issues between the various states and statuses, such as Start Progress and Stop Progress, and Resolve, Close, and Reopen.  The same concepts should apply to Sprints.

There are arduous workarounds, such as completing, deleting and recreating a Sprint.  Frankly, this is not a viable workaround, it is more of a desparate hack.  Project Managment is hard enough without having rework imposed by tools.  As an example, the rework of completing a Sprint, deleting a Sprint, then rebuilding a brand new Sprint from scratch, exactly like the Sprint which was just deleted, for the sole purpose of having an idential Sprint that is Inactive, due to JIRA lacking an Inactivate button.

This new feature would function exactly like the Start Progress and Stop Progress buttons do for an Issue.
fields.summary: deactivate or inactivate a sprint in place

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Directory backups generated during the upgrade process in Linux / Unix overrides any manually generated backup if they have the same file name

h3. Environment
* Jira installed in Linux / Unix environment
* Upgrade is performed with the installer

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Jira 7.12.1 in Ubuntu using the Linux installer
# Create some sample data
# Manually backup the Jira installation and Jira home directory with the name {{jira-<old-version>-back.zip}}. In this case the file would be jira-7.12.1-back.zip. Note the file size
# Upgrade Jira to 8.0.0 using the installer
# Opt-in for 'Back up JIRA home directory?'
# Notice that both manual backups are overridden by the upgrade process with the same file name

h3. Expected Results
Jira installer detected backup file exist and either:
* Stop the installation and returns an error message indicating backup file already exist
* Backup the directories with a unique file name for example jira-7.12.1-back-1.zip

h3. Actual Results
The manual backup files are overriden
 
h3. Notes
* This is only observed in Linux / Unix environment 
* Windows installer will stop the upgrade and throws an error 

h3.Workaround
Avoid using the file name in this format for manual backups - {{jira-<old-version>-back.zip}}
fields.summary: Linux installer overrides Jira backup during upgrade

fields.description: Currently we can change the sequence in which the transition buttons are displayed in the view issue screen by the setting the opsbar-sequence property for that transition. But the issue actions (which can be accessed by typing '.') or the actions for a sub-task show the transitions as ordered by the transition id in the workflow. It does not follow the sequence id given with opsbar-sequence property provided under transition.
fields.summary: Actions for the sub-tasks should be displayed in the same sequence provided for opsbar-sequence property

fields.description:
Currently, on Jira Service Desk and Jira Core/Software, the batch email feature can't be configured - the timespan is hardcoded within the application.

The suggestion is to make the timespan configurable on a per-project basis.
fields.summary: Provide the ability to configure the timespan of batch mail feature

Apdex features were added in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-67621

In the comments here, we discussed new, detailed documentation around this feature. We would love to see the new documentation that is specific to this new feature in Jira.
fields.summary: Create Apdex Documentation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

You are able to click on bars on the Time Since Gadget to get those specific issues shown in the Issue Navigator. However, if a Date field is used in the "Date Field:" section instead of a Date Time field, then Jira will throw an invalid format error.  

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Add a Time Since Gadget to the Dashboard
# Create two Custom Fields. One of type Date Time and the other Date
# Give some issues in Jira values to these field
# On the Time Since Gadget "Date Field:" specify the Date time field
# Click any bar on the chart, this should return proper results in the Issue Navigator
# Now change back the  "Date Field:" to a field of Type Date. 
# Select any item on the chart now. 

h3. Expected Results

Returns the Issues in the Issue Navigator without errors. 

h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the UI of the Issue Navigator:
{noformat}
Date value '2019-03-24 23:59' for field 'duedate' is invalid. Valid formats include: 'YYYY/MM/DD', 'YYYY-MM-DD', or a period format e.g. '-5d', '4w 2d'.
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

Currently the only workaround is to use a Date Time field instead of a Date Field.
fields.summary: Clicking on an item on the Time Since Gadget will give an error invalid format error in the Issue Navigator

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When re-ordering the History tab in descending order, on JIRA issues, the column names do not stay at the top. 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click the History tab and observe the title name Field, Original Value & New Value
 !image-2019-03-05-17-08-18-900.png|thumbnail! 
 # Click to sort on descending order. 

h3. Expected Results
The title name Field, Original Value & New Value should stay at the top

h3. Actual Results
The title name Field, Original Value & New Value is moved to the bottom
 !image-2019-03-05-17-09-45-865.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Reordering history tab breaks column titles

fields.description:
h5. Problem Definition
Based on this suggestion request JRASERVER-21690, we do not officially support Database Clustering. However, the AWS Quick Start template is using RDS clustering. 

h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great to clarification (or statement in documentation) on our support scope, specifically for RDS clustering.
fields.summary: Clarification on the support scope for RDS cluster.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Normally suitable field values are supplemented when an inline issue is created in backlog screen. For example, "user1" is automatically supplemented in an assignee field if a user created an issue from quick filter that has a JQL expression {{assignee=user1}} .
 But these field value supplement doesn't work well when quick filter is applied on a backlog of a board created from a saved filter.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create users – "user1" and "user2"
 # Create scrum project and name it as "testproj"
 # Create a search filter with following condition and save it with name "filter A"
 {{project=testproj and assignee in (user1, user2)}}
 # Create a board using "filter A" and name it as "board A"
 # Click "Configure" in the backlog screen on "board A", and create a quick filter with following condition
 {{assignee=user1}}
 # Inline-create an issue by the link "Create Issue" in backlog screen on "board A"
 # Create a search filter with following condition and save it with name "filter B"
 {{project=testproj and assignee in (user1, user2, EMPTY)}}
 # Create a board using "filter B" and name it as "board B"
 # Click "Configure" in the backlog screen on "board B", and create a quick filter with following condition
 {{assignee=user1}}
 # Inline-create an issue by the link "Create Issue" in backlog screen on "board A" and "board B"

h3. Expected Results

Issues created from inline-creation in both board A and B has a preset field value "user1" as an assignee.
h3. Actual Results

"user1" is set in assignee field in board A, but the assignee in board B is left unassigned.
h3. Notes

Above is just one of examples.
h3. Workaround

Manually supplement the values.
fields.summary: Sufficient issue field values not supplemented for Inline issue creation when quick filter applied on board that is created from saved filter

fields.description:
This is issue is to track future support for postgresql 12, due out later this year.   

See also:

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-68578

h4. Note
There is a false-positive warning in Jira 8.13.12 for Postgresql 12: "_PostgreSQL 12 is not supported. You should migrate to a supported database version._". Necessary corresponding changes need to be done in ATST plugin, the problem is tracked here JRASERVER-72919. 
(i) You can safely ignore the warning for Jira 8.13.12+ versions.
fields.summary: JIRA support for postgresql 12

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Unlike When clicking on votes to view the voters of an issue, you are unable to scroll through the voters list as the scrollbar is missing. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Head to an issue.
 # Click on Votes.

h3. Expected behavior

User can scroll through the Voters list.
h3. Actual behavior

User is not able to scroll through the Voters list due to missing scrollbar.
h3. Workaround

Head to an issue, then, click *More > Voters*. This will list out all the voters in the issue.
fields.summary: Unable to scroll through Voters list due to missing scrollbar.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, if user tried to upload an attachment which contains UTF-8 based characters (Eg: "Schlüssel.txt") with REST API using tool like python library, the fill failed to be attached and following stack trace will be logged in Jira's log:

{code}
2019-02-22 12:41:57,886 https-jsse-nio-443-exec-86 WARN vicky 761x3023604x3 spa8tc 10.115.15.193 /rest/api/2/issue/TEST-17788/attachments [c.a.j.issue.managers.DefaultAttachmentManager] Cannot create attachment without a filename - inline content? See http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-10825 (file=attachment-3058042277748636332.tmp).
2019-02-22 12:41:57,887 https-jsse-nio-443-exec-86 ERROR vicky 761x3023604x3 spa8tc 10.115.15.193 /rest/api/2/issue/TEST-17788/attachments [c.a.j.r.v2.issue.IssueAttachmentsResource] Error saving attachment
java.lang.NullPointerException
{code}

The problem happens because some tolls use the extended notation "filename*=<enc>''xxxx" notation which breaks the filename.


h3. Environment

Jira 7.12.1, 7.13.1


h3. Expected Results

Attachment attached to issue with UTF-8 character.


h3. Actual Results

Attachment not attached to issue with UTF-8 character and following stack trace is logged in Jira's log:

{code}
2019-02-22 12:41:57,886 https-jsse-nio-443-exec-86 WARN vicky 761x3023604x3 spa8tc 10.115.15.193 /rest/api/2/issue/TEST-17788/attachments [c.a.j.issue.managers.DefaultAttachmentManager] Cannot create attachment without a filename - inline content? See http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-10825 (file=attachment-3058042277748636332.tmp).
2019-02-22 12:41:57,887 https-jsse-nio-443-exec-86 ERROR vicky 761x3023604x3 spa8tc 10.115.15.193 /rest/api/2/issue/TEST-17788/attachments [c.a.j.r.v2.issue.IssueAttachmentsResource] Error saving attachment
java.lang.NullPointerException
{code}


h3. Workaround

Attach attachment with CURL command.
fields.summary: Prevent attachment from breaking when uploading filename with UTF-8 character

fields.description:
We are trying to build an interface from a legacy ticket system to JIRA. We would like to be able to assign tickets from one group to another where each group has its own JIRA project.

We cannot find a way to move an issue to a different project via the RPC API.
fields.summary: Please add ability to Move Issues between projects via the SOAP / RPC API
User and Group Management events in JIRA audit log are anonymous

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Comments from emails managed by the Jira's regular incoming mail handler are able to change the status of an issue, but doesn't update the SLA due to the regular mail handler doesn't do not perform any actions on WorkflowTransitionUtil class after creating new comments under the ticket

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create Jira regular incoming mail handler and config 'time to resolution' custom filed for Jira service desk.  
# Make a comment by email to change the status of an issue in order to update the SLA.
# Issue status is changed as expected

h3. Expected Results

* SLA pause or unpause as expected. 

h3. Actual Results

* SLA doesn't pause or unpause as expected. 

h3. Workaround

* User JSD mail handler instead of the regular incoming mail handler as JSD's mail handler use CommentCreatedEvent to update the SLA custom fields.
fields.summary: Regular Jira incoming mail handler should turn on dispatching CommentCreatedEvent in Jira when comment come from mail

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Copy-paste an image via CTRL+V or CMD+V in Issue Detail View of the Issue Navigator will cause an error: 

h3. Environment

- None

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Copy any image that you would like to paste into one of the issues shown in the Issue Detail View. 
 # Paste the image onto the issue: 
 !Screenshot 2019-03-01 at 8.38.10 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 # Click either Upload or Cancel button, it doesn't matter. 
 # Try to paste the image in another issue or in the same issue will cause an error. 

h3. Expected Results

Expecting the image to be able to paste normally. 

h3. Actual Results

 !Screenshot 2019-03-01 at 8.34.19 PM.png|thumbnail! 
{code:none}
The issue no longer exists. 
{code} 

h3. Notes

- None

h3. Workaround

# Refresh the entire web page will re-enable you to paste the image again, but only one time. 
# Or you can open the issue separately in a single Issue View, the function is not affected there.
fields.summary: Copy paste an image in Issue Detail View of Issue Navigator cause error after one-time

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When user translated "Version Picker" type custom field to "Translate Custom Version" and click version number on the issue, search feature is not working properly due to "{{Field 'Translate Custom Version' does not exist or you do not have permission to view it.}}" error.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create Custom field "Custom Version" with "Version Picker (multiple or single)" type
 # Translate custom field (ex. Translate Custom Version)
 # Add value to "Translate Custom Version" field on a issue
 # Click version number which is placed "Translate Custom Version" field

h3. Expected Results

JQL should be below.
 - {{project="TP" AND "Custom Version"="Version 2.0" ORDER BY priority ASC}}
 - {{project="TP" AND cf[xxxx]="Version 2.0" ORDER BY priority ASC}}

h3. Actual Results

JQL use below query and return "Field 'Translate Custom Version' does not exist or you do not have permission to view it." error
 - {{project="TP" AND "Translate Custom Version"="Version 2.0" ORDER BY priority ASC}}

h3. Workaround

Change translated field name to initial custom field name on JQL manually.
fields.summary: "Version Picker" type custom field link is not working when field is translated

fields.description:
h2. Problem
When performing multiple issue type scheme changes at the same time, it can result in issue type schemes being reverted to use the Default Issue Type Scheme.
* This occurs when making simultaneous changes with multiple projects via from the Project Admin page: Project settings > Issue types > Actions > Use a different scheme

h5. Steps to Reproduce
# Generate 2000 projects.
# Created a new issue type scheme, named 'test issue type scheme'.
# Associated 1854 projects to the newly created issue type scheme 'test issue type scheme'.
# Updated three projects simultaneously, originally associated with the default issue type scheme, and set it to use the new 'test issue type scheme'
** *Simultaneously* via *Project settings* > *Issue types* > *Actions* > *Use a different scheme*.
** In this case, I had 3 browser tabs open and quickly triggered the change at once using shortcuts to click "OK"
# Review the number of total projects associated with 'test issue type scheme'.

h5. Expected Behaviour
The number of projects associated with 'test issue type scheme' should now be 1857

h5. Actual Behaviour
The number of projects associated with 'test issue type scheme' is 626.  The missing projects were reverted back to use the Default Issue Type Scheme
fields.summary: Regression: Projects may be reverted to the default issue type scheme during the change due to race condition

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The resizing of the 'Note' textbox in the 'Share this issue' is broken.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to any issue and click on *Share this issue* button:
!share-button.png|thumbnail! 
# Try to resize the Note text box;
!normal-screen.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The text box is resized within the window boundaries.

h3. Actual Results
It's possible to resize the textbox outside the window boundaries and therefore you cannot resize back.
The *Share* and *Cancel* buttons go with the text box, and depending on how large is the resize it's not possible to see the buttons:
!broken-resize.png|thumbnail! 
!broken-resize-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
If you add several recipients into the "Name Email" field the modal also behaves in the same way, pushing the text box and the submit button to an inaccessible area.

h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: The resizing of the 'Note' textbox in the 'Share this issue' is broken

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Since there are a lot of interpretation on what 'In Progress' means in a status(It could be 'Triaging' or 'Investigating'), it is better if the gadget returns result from the statusCategory = 'In Progress' instead of the status = 'In Progress' itself. This will return all the issues with that are in In Progress.
fields.summary: 'Issue in progress' gadget should perform search using statusCategory = 'In progress' instead of status = 'In Progress'

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The per issue indexing time is strongly determined by the time taken by various {{FieldIndexer}} (plugin) modules. As a result, badly behaving plugins can severely limit Jira’s maximum indexing throughput. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add logging and performance statistics for FieldIndexer plugin points. 
This will help to identify the top contributors to the indexing performance and how it affects overall indexing time. 

h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: Add performance statistics for FieldIndexer plugin points during issue reindexing

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In a cloud migration doc [Migrate from Jira Server to Jira Cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=779160826], the following phrase sounds misleading.

bq. *Upgrade Jira Server:* If you aren't already, you'll need to be on version 7.0.0 or higher before migrating. To learn how to upgrade, check out [Upgrading Jira applications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ADMINJIRASERVER/Upgrading+Jira+applications].

Basically, it should be on the latest *Feature release* at the point as described in [Jira Server to Cloud FAQs|https://www.atlassian.com/cloud-migration/jira-faq#faq-817fbf20-7a58-43c7-a96e-63be8e929c91].

bq. If you're on Jira Server version 7.13.1 or earlier, you'll need to upgrade before migrating.

h3. Suggested Solution

Please update [Migrate from Jira Server to Jira Cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=779160826] with considering the above information.
fields.summary: Cloud Migration Document

fields.description:

Please change the restrictions to allow everyone to view.

Will be crucial as we migrate form JDK 8 to 11

Body of the document will need to be send to individuals on an as needed basis until restrictions are changed

fields.summary: Update Jira's Supported Platforms page for Safari

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Whenever users try to attach files directly on comments while on *Visual* mode, Jira won't load the attachment on the issue.

h3. Environment
* Jira 8.0.1
* Safari 12.0.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access Jira 8.0.1 while using Safari 12.0.2
# Browse any issue
# Click on *Comment* while on Visual Mode, then click on *Attachment > Browse* and choose a file 

h3. Expected Results

Jira will add the attachment to the issue successfully

h3. Actual Results

The file is not added to Jira. No errors are thrown in the logs or in the UI

h3. Workaround

The same behavior does not happen when attaching files while on *Text* mode. Also, if the mode is changed from *Text* to *Visual* again, Jira will attach the file normally.
fields.summary: Attaching files on comments not working properly on Safari 12.0.2

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When deleting a project Jira says it was successfully deleted even though it was not. The project remains in the database. 
After that Jira start throwing the following error
{noformat}
rest/gadget/1.0/statistics [c.a.jira.permission.DefaultPermissionSchemeManager] No permission scheme is associated with project 'ProjectName'
{noformat}
If you look in the "_nodeassociation_" tables using the following query, you can see that the association was actually deleted.
{code:sql}
select * from project where ID not in (select source_node_id from nodeassociation where sink_node_entity='PermissionScheme')
{code}
h3. How to reproduce

Try to delete a project.
h3. Actual Result

Jira says the project is deleted but if you look in the database you can still see the entry for it.
h3. Expected results

JIRA should delete the project.
h3. Workaround

None at the moment.

Note: Jira should not continue the deletion if there are any errors, this would avoid the permission scheme from being disassociated and cause further problems.
fields.summary: Deleting project completes but the data remains in the database.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a project category is updated via the API, the webhook setup for project updates doesn't send the new project category. Instead, it sends the old category. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create two project categories. 
# Assign a project to one of the categories.
# Go to https://webhook.site/ to get a webhook URL.
# Create a webhook that fires on project updates to the URL you'll get from the website above. 
# Make a project category update via a REST call. For instance: 
{code:borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6A8EB3|bgColor=#F8F8F8}
curl -k -X PUT -u username:password https://jira.example.com/rest/api/2/project/SCRTEST -d '{"categoryId": 10100}' -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -v
{code}

h3. Expected Results
The data sent to the webhook includes the new project category ID *10100*.
h3. Actual Results
The data sent to the webhook includes the new project category ID, *10000* in our example:
{code:json|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6A8EB3|bgColor=#F8F8F8}
    "projectCategory": {
      "self": "https://jira.arbi.local:8443/rest/api/2/projectCategory/10000",
      "id": 10000,
      "name": "Cat 1",
      "description": ""
    },
{code}
h3. Notes
This issue will occur if the project category is changed by a Jira add-on such as [ira Command Line Interface (CLI)|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/6398/jira-command-line-interface-cli] or the [Run CLI Actions in Jira|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1210941/run-cli-actions-in-jira]
h3. Workaround
Change the project category from the UI.
fields.summary: Updating a project category via the API sends incorrect webhook data

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When viewing 'Attachments' in list view, there are three columns which are 'file name', 'file size' and 'file upload date and time'. We would like for the ability to add different columns such as 'labels' for these attachments to be easily categorized.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When upgrading to Jira 8.x, it's not possible to upgrade Script Runner to its latest version by clicking on:
* Update
* Manually updating the app (i.e Specifying the URI of the download version or uploading the plugin from your computer)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Ensure you're using Jira 8 with Script Runner 5.4.49 or any other previous version
 # Clicking on update through the "Manage apps" page
#* If the instance has no access to the Internet, you can upload the app manually
# Jira confirms that Script Runner upgrade has been done
# Upon refreshing the page, the app was not updated correctly and it's still showing that an upgrade for this particular app is required

h3. Workaround

Uninstall the app, and install it again (this procedure won't erase your Script Runner data)
fields.summary: Problem to upgrade Script Runner from 5.4.49 to 5.4.49-jira8

fields.description: Using Jira as a relatively small company makes it very often more complicated to configure a lot of things. It would be a nice feature if this could be applied on a global scale instead of having different settings for each project.
fields.summary: Global Issue Detail View

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

We have an issue here with JIRA that prevent us to adopt it fully in our company .

In the French language, we use accents, such as é,à,é,etc.. and we need Confluence to ignore those accents for searchs, like google does.

For instance the search text: "majore", should give us pages with "majoré" or "majore" or "majorè"

h3. Suggested Solution
 
It would be very useful if we could configure the search feature to be able to ignore accents.
fields.summary: Allow search feature to ignore accent

fields.description:
h3. Summary

With https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36135 we began officially supporting the MySQL 5.7 with the {{utf8mb4}} collation.

The documentation can be found here: [Connecting Jira applications to MySQL 5.7|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/connecting-jira-applications-to-mysql-5-7-966063305.html]

However, using this supported platform in Jira 8 still prompts the following Health Check warning:

{code}
Your mysql database is currently using an unsupported collation: utf8mb4_bin. You should change this to a supported collation: utf8_bin
{code}

h3. Environment
* Jira 8.0 
* MySQL 5.7 using {{utf8mb4_bin}} as outlined in [Connecting Jira applications to MySQL 5.7|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/connecting-jira-applications-to-mysql-5-7-966063305.html]

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Jira 8
# Set {{database-type}} to {{mysql}} in {{dbconfig.xml}} ( (!) this is not correct )
# Setup MySQL 5.7 as outlined in [Connecting Jira applications to MySQL 5.7|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/connecting-jira-applications-to-mysql-5-7-966063305.html]

h3. Expected Results
Jira 8 runs using the supported database collation without errors.

h3. Actual Results
The following error is thrown on startup:

{code}
Your MySQL database is currently using an unsupported collation: utf8mb4_bin. You should change this to a supported collation: utf8_bin
{code}

Screenshot:

 !health check error.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Fix
To resolve the issue, you can run {{config.sh/bat}} to update your {{dbconfig.xml}}, or manually change {{database-type}} from {{mysql}} to {{mysql57}} in your {{dbconfig.xml}} file.

This is discussed in [Connecting Jira applications to MySQL 5.7|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/connecting-jira-applications-to-mysql-5-7-966063305.html#ConnectingJiraapplicationstoMySQL5.7-Knownissues]

(i) Only works in JIRA 8.
fields.summary: MySQL 5.7 running utf8mb4_bin throws Health Check error

fields.description:
Jira Server 7.5 and above are currently supported in the Azure platform as well as the Azure SQL database, but there's no specific documentation about what configuration/template is best.

There's this document: https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/getting-started-with-jira-data-center-on-azure-938846970.html, but it was created towards Data center instances.

The request is to create a document specific to Jira Server instances telling what configuration is best to be used in Azure(e.g. database throughput speed).
fields.summary: Improve Documentation about running Jira Server on Azure/Azure SQL

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The list of projects while sharing filters is ordered (what looks like) as per ASCII values and not alphabetically.
Listing the projects while creating an issue orders the projects alphabetically.

h3. Environment
* 7.6.9
* 7.13.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create projects with names similar to *"Android", "Blackhole", "absolute", "andromeda"*
 # Try to share a filter to projects and click on the dropdown list


h3. Expected Results
The list of projects should be Alphabetical order:

"absolute"
"Android"
"andromeda"
"Blackhole"

h3. Actual Results
The listing will be according to ASCII value of the character strings:
Android
Blackhole
absolute
andromeda

h3. Notes
This could be considered an improvement as well but since the behaviour is not consistent across the product we consider this a bug


h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Project listing is not alphabetically ordered while sharing filters

fields.description: h3. Summary In some rare cases, preview image attachment macro in issue description open link to the wrong image, while renders the correct image. h3. Steps to Reproduce Not clear, at the time of reporting, JRASERVER-65890 has this problem. See: !JRASERVER-68923_image.png|thumbnail! h3. Expected Results The correct link is displayed * Based on JRASERVER-65890, it should be {{secure/attachment/292188/clusterlock.png}} h3. Actual Results The wrong link is displayed * Based on JRASERVER-65890, it's {{/secure/attachment/341192/341192_jmx_comparing_sample_page_img001.png}} h3. fields.description:
Currently, Jira seems to be using two different sort indexes for subtasks: the order within the parent task (seen in the subtasks list when the parent issue is opened) and the "Rank" on the board.

This is quite confusing and forces us to always reorder issues twice, within the parent issue and on the board.

Therefore, Jira should use the same order of subtasks in both views. If this is difficult due to it being a breaking change, either add a board configuration option to do this or at least add a button to explicitly perform the synchronization within the issue (e.g., "adjust rank on agile boards according to subtask order").
fields.summary: Order of subtasks in an issue should correspond to order of subtasks on the board

fields.description:
When I move multiple subtasks at once using a bulk operation, they'll be reordered within the destination parent issue. This is problematic because the order is usually relevant, indicating the order in which they should be implemented, and this order is still valid when the subtasks are moved to another issue.

Therefore, the bulk operation should preserve the relative order of the subtasks in the destination issue.
fields.summary: Moving multiple subtasks in a bulk operation should preserve their relative order

fields.description:
Adding a custom event described on [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/adding-a-custom-event-861253643.html] causes batched notifications to ignore event resulting in no e-mail send on transition with configured custom event.

Also these events are not handled right now:

public static final Long ISSUE_WORKSTARTED_ID = 11L;
public static final Long ISSUE_WORKSTOPPED_ID = 12L;

from what I can see they are used in "Jira default workflow" firing events on some transitions

 

*Workaround:*

Turn off batched email notifications and use old email notifications

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/configuring-email-notifications-938847633.html]
fields.summary: Batched notifications does not support custom events

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Unable to reset OAuth settings for a DVCS account (github or bitbucket) when there are multiple DVCS accounts present
h3. Environment

JIRA 7.x - JIRA 8.0.1 linked to *multiple* github and / or bitbucket accounts
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create at least two OAuth applications in GitHub and / or Bitbucket. Take a note of the Client IDs and Security Keys for the created accounts
 # Link JIRA to these applications via JIRA -> DVCS Accounts -> Link Bitbucket Cloud or GitHub account
 # On the latest configured account in JIRA -> DVCS Accounts select tripple dots menu to the right of the account and select "Reset OAuth Settings", "Configure OAuth for account [accountname]" should come up - take a note of the current key and authorizing account

h3. Expected Results

JIRA should display the correct "Current Key" value and "Authorizing account" and should allow to reset the account token
h3. Actual Results

JIRA shows "Current Key" and "Authorizing account" value of the very first DVCS account configured which is incorrect (and it actually shows the same key and authorizing account across all other DVCS accounts in JIRA) As a result, unable to reset the OAuth settings as per the ticket summary.
 When trying to Edit the settings (i.e. click EDIT on the Configure OAuth for account [accountname]" and proceeding to change the Key and Secret, and then hitting "Regenerate Access Token" - JIRA comes up with "OAuth key must not be blank" value even though the values are filled in
h3. Notes

This happens only when multiple DVCS accounts are present in JIRA. When there's only one DVCS account configured, there's no issue
h3. Workaround I

Delete the DVCS account that requires token renewal in JIRA and re-add it

h3. Workaround II

* Identify your organization ID by hitting https://<base-url>/rest/bitbucket/1.0/repositories. You're looking for an organizationId value that matches the organization you want, which you can tell from the repositoryUrl value.
* Using Postman or curl, make a x-www-form-urlencoded POST to https://<base-url>/rest/bitbucket/1.0/org/<org-id>/oauth, passing the parameters
{panel}
organizationId: <org-id>
key: <key>
secret: <secret>
{panel}
* If you want, you can confirm this worked by running SELECT * FROM AO_E8B6CC_ORGANIZATION_MAPPING in your DB and confirming that the values are in place (directly modifying this table is likely another route to solving this problem, but would likely require a restart and the next step to take effect).
* In your browser, hit https://<base-url>/secure/admin/RegenerateGithubEnterpriseOauthToken.jspa?organization=<org-id>, click Retry if prompted, then authorize the app on the GHE side.
fields.summary: Unable to reset OAuth settings for DVCS Accounts

fields.description:
h4. Issue
 * Currently, when we bulk edit 'Change Fix Version/s' for different issues in the different project, the 'Change Fix Version/s' shows in the 'Unavailable Actions' at the bottom of the 'Step 3 of 4: Operation Details' page due to 'NOTE: This operation can be performed only on issues from ONE project.'
 !fixversions.png|thumbnail!

h4. Feature request
 * We understand that fix versions are local to projects, but in some customer's configuration, all different projects have exactly the same fix versions. We would love to be able to bulk edit all the issues in different projects.

 h4. Workaround

* Bulk edit issues from one project at a time.
fields.summary: Bulk edit 'Change Fix Version/s' is not available for issues in different project

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently if you change a key of a project or name filters will no longer work. Filters should be updated when a key changes or project name.
h3. Suggested Solution
Filters should be stored with the project IDs and their queries should be translated to project keys/names. 
Any other solution that would guarantee all filters are accurate after a project key/name change is acceptable. 
h3. Workaround
# Identify the filters that need an update before making the project key/name change and store their IDs. 
# Once the project key/name change is done, run a SQL to replace the old project key with the new one in all the filters saved from the previous step.
fields.summary: When a project changes name/key etc any filters used in that project should be updated as well.

fields.description:
In the page [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/upgrading-jira-server-manual-938846939.html]

 Has the following recommendation:
{quote}
h2. Install the database driver

*If you're using an Oracle or MySQL database*, download a new JDBC driver. For other databases, you can omit this step.
 If the driver is up to date, you can also copy it from your previous version.
 # Download one of the following drivers:

 * 
 ** *Oracle:* JDBC driver 12.2.0.1.
 ** *MySQL:* {color:#de350b}the latest JDBC driver.{color}

 # Place it in {{<installation-directory>/lib}}.{quote}
 However Jira can't currently use the latest mysql jdbc driver, which is version 8.  Instead Jira needs to be using the latest 5.1 driver as explained in both the supported platforms doc and the Connecting Jira to mysql documentation.   

When users follow this guide and install the 8.0 version, Jira can't correctly connect to these database types.
fields.summary: Upgrading Jira Manual documentation had incorrect mysql jdbc driver recommendation

fields.description:
As a user, "Remaining" should recalculate automatically based on logged work and Original Estimate.

Current behaviour, when manually modifying the "Estimate" field, the "Remaining" remains the same.

This can cause some problems, for example, If someone incorrectly inputs the estimated amount of time for an issues and makes a mistake, they have to update the estimated time and then manually recalculate the remaining time.
fields.summary: "Remaining" should recalculate automatically based on logged work and Original Estimate

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Jira importer allows importing issues from different systems. During the import process, the import may fail to create some issues for various reasons such as missing statuses, post-function, etc. After the import is finished, Jira displays post-import detailed logs to show the number of issues that were imported successfully and the number of those failed.

In certain cases, the logs report inaccurate results in the number of issues that have been created and the issues that need to be re-indexed.

For example, the below logs are for an import of two issues, with only *one* issue that was successfully created:
{code:java}
2019-02-22 23:18:44,022 INFO - Importing issue: [externalId='autoid-7605094558926580211', summary='Import fails']
2019-02-22 23:18:44,033 ERROR - Error importing issue [externalId='autoid-7605094558926580211', summary='Import fails']
com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.external.ExternalException: Status UNKNOW1 cannot be found in JIRA neither by name and id
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.ExternalUtils.normalizeStatus(ExternalUtils.java:219)
...
2019-02-22 23:18:44,034 INFO - Importing issue: [externalId='autoid-6008772327090099268', summary='Success']
2019-02-22 23:18:44,696 INFO - Reindexing last 1 issues imported ...
2019-02-22 23:18:44,768 INFO - Reindexing took 65 ms.
2019-02-22 23:18:44,770 INFO - 2 issues successfully created 
2019-02-22 23:18:44,771 INFO - ------------------------------
2019-02-22 23:18:44,772 INFO - Finished Importing : Issues
...
2019-02-22 23:18:44,774 INFO - ------------------------------
2019-02-22 23:18:44,774 INFO - No issues need to be reindexed.{code}
Here is the corresponding screenshot:

!image-2019-02-23-00-29-44-100.png|width=98,height=71!

In the above logs, the report shows that 2 issues were created and no further issues need to be re-indexed. However, only one issue was created successfully as the message in the UI indicates.

 h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a CSV import with a mix of issues that are guaranteed to succeed and some which are guaranteed to fail
 # Run the external CSV import wizard
 # After the import is complete, click on 'download a detailed log'
 # The logs will show that all issues have been created but only the correct ones are indexed

In some other cases, the issues are successfully created but not re-indexed. In this case a manual re-index is required for the issues to become searchable. 
h3. Expected Results

Jira will always show the correct results of the issues that were successfully created, imported or the issues that needs to be re-indexed
h3. Actual Results

A discrepancy is shown in the import logs with inaccurate number of the issues that have been created or those that required a re-index.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available. It is important however, to do a manual re-index after doing the import to see which tickets have been successfully imported.
fields.summary: External System CSV Import report is not accurate

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When adding a value to a custom field that uses the type 'Select List (single choice)' and 'Label', the values added are not rendered correctly and is partially cut off in the bottom. For example, when selecting 'yes', it will appear as 'ves'. This issue is also apparent in the 'Labels' field in the View Screen.

This issue is apparent in all Create/Edit/View screen.
h3. Environment
 * Tested in all Browsers (Firefox, IE, Chrome)
 * Jira 7.13, 8.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field 'Test Option' with the type 'Select List (single choice)'. Add options such as 'yes' and 'no'. Make it appear in all screens.
 # Create a custom field 'Test Label'. Make it appear in all screens.
 # Click Create button on the top navigation bar. 
 # Choose the option 'yes' for 'Test Option' and add a label 'NewBug'.
 # Observe the fields in View and Edit screen.

h3. Expected Results

The value of the fields will render correctly.
h3. Actual Results

The value of the fields are not rendered correctly.
h3. Workaround

There is currently no workaround.
fields.summary: Labels and Select List (single choice) values are not rendered correctly in Windows.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating an issue from the Indexing page, the date and date/time picker does not pop out and user will not able to pick a date or time.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Administration -> System -> Indexing
 # Click Create button on the top navigation bar
 # Ensure that a custom field with type Date or Date/Time picker is on the screen.

h3. Expected Results

The Date/Time Picker calendar will pop out.
h3. Actual Results

The Date/Time Picker calendar does not pop out.

The below exception is thrown in the browser console :
{noformat}
jira.webresources:calendar-lib.js:3 Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'DEF_DATE_FORMAT' of undefinedat new Calendar (jira.webresources:calendar-lib.js:3)at i (jira.webresources:calendar-lib.js:6)at HTMLAnchorElement.<anonymous> (jira.webresources:calendar-lib.js:6)at HTMLAnchorElement.dispatch (batch.js?locale=en-US:65)at HTMLAnchorElement.v.handle (batch.js?locale=en-US:65)
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Create issue from the other pages beside the Indexing page.
fields.summary: The Date/Time picker calendar does not pop out when creating an issue from the Indexing page.

fields.description:
When viewing the Jira Project's Dashboard, it would be nice to see the cards have a notification word on the top right hand side.

 

See [4 seconds recording|[http://recordit.co/KnQvRmhnvN].]

 Same scenarios:
 # When a new ticket is *created* and added to the Project's Dashboard, the ticket card displays {color:#00875a}*"NEW"*{color} on the top right hand corner of the card with a date time signature below it.
 # When a newly created ticket's *STATUS* is *updated*, the ticket card displays the new STATUS ( In Progress, Done, etc., ) in {color:#FF0000}*bold red*{color} for at least 24 hours with a date time signature below it.
 # When a newly created ticket's *text* (any section e..g., Summary, Description, Comment) is *updated*, the ticket card displays the new change ( e..g., Summary In Description, etc.,) in {color:#0747a6}*blue bold*{color} bold for at least 24 hours with a data time signature below it.

Thanks Atlassian for reading.
fields.summary: NIce To Have | Dashboard View | Card | Add latest action word on card with data time below

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

There are two different driver versions listed in the public documentation for Oracle 12c databases for Jira 8.0.
h3. Environment

Jira 8.0 public documentation

*Supported Platforms* [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/supported-platforms-938846830.html]

*Upgrading Manually* [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/upgrading-jira-server-manual-938846939.html] 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Check the supported Oracle driver on the Supported Platforms page - it lists 12.2.0.1 in the Oracle database section.
 # Check the supported Oracle driver on the Upgrading Manually page - it lists 12.1.0.1 in the Installing driver section.

h3. Expected Results

Both documents should list the same driver version. 
h3. Actual Results

The documents list different versions. 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is conflicting information in the public support pages.  Once the correct driver is established, the public pages should be updated and this ticket will be closed.
fields.summary: Jira 8.0 Oracle 12c driver listed as 2 different versions on Supported Platforms vs. Manual Upgrade
